newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Amex says La Caixa to market its cards in Spain.
newsitem.headline: Amex says La Caixa to market its cards in Spain.

text.p: American Express Co said on Wednesday it had signed an agreement with La Caixa, by which the leading Spanish savings bank will market its cards in Spain.
This a major blow for VISA International which had earlier this year tried to ban its bank members from issuing Amex cards.

"The agreement with La Caixa is, without doubt, a very important step in our worldwide strategy of establishing strategic alliances with leading financial institutions," Harvey Golub, the chairman and CEO of American Express, said in a statement.

Amex spokeswoman in London Sally Susman also told Reuters this was "the first major partnership" concluded by the card company after the European Commission clarified its position regarding VISA's intention to prohibit its European bank members from marketing rival products.
VISA abandonned the plan before the summer following a warning by European Competition Commissioner Karel Van Miert that the proposal could not be accepted.
Amex has until recently marketed its cards directly to the public.
La Caixa is Spain and Europe's leading savings bank with assets under management of more than eight trillion pesetas. The bank has a network of 3,000 branch offices. -- Brussels newsroom 322 2876841
